channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT

item.title: Report X-2023120742
item.description:
Report X-2023120742

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO SIX PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH PACKAGE HAD TWO TO FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZE7804J0111493702, 1ZE7804J0113361538, 1ZE7804J0103370145, 1ZE7804J0130531778, AND 1ZE7804J0135377141. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM UTAH USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER E7804J, EPIC GLOBAL PARCEL, 871 S AUTO MALL DR., AMERICAN FORK UT 84003-2472.

item.title: Report E-2023120203
item.description:
Report E-2023120203

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: SALT LAKE CTY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 1, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2735 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enviro Care, Inc. (EC) to remediate the impacted site. EV personnel deployed absorbents to the release and utilized hand tools to remediate the site. The crew containerized the one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack. All UN2735-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) cubic yard bag for future disposal.

item.title: Report I-2023090116
item.description:
Report I-2023090116

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-23T00:32:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-25
  • City: HEBER CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PILOT THOMAS LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver encountered icy road surface which casued him to loose control of his vehicle which resulted in a rollover accident . Pup trailer separated from the lead trailer. Diesel fuel leaked from Compartment One dome cover for approximately 4 hours while waiting for the equipment needed to extract the diesel fuel from the pup trailer. Broadbent and Associates is overseeing the remediation work with Lincoln Environmental doing the actual work. Excavation is expected to begin in June once the snow has melted. Wasatch County Health Department was on scene and approved the remediation plan.
